p: Trypanosoma brucei is a protozoan that causes human African trypanosomiasis (HAT). There are currently only four drugs available for its treatment, namely pentamidine, melarsoprol, suramin, and eflornithine. Considering the lack of phytochemical and pharmacological data available for plants with efficacy against trypanosomes and aiming at proposing alternative treatments for HAT, an initial screening of the EOs of the five species of Baccharis were carried out against T. brucei ( Table 3).
